definition: variant of 邱吉爾|邱吉尔[Qiu1 ji2 er3]
surname Qiu
variant of 丘[qiu1]/hillock
mound/hillock/grave/classifier for fields
lucky/giga- (meaning billion or 10^9)
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou

sentences.english: It is very smooth (Churchill used to enjoy similar wines from nearby Melnik).
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔也曾在附近的梅尔尼克品尝过类似的酒。

sentences.english: Churchill found that subalterns were two a penny in India and invited nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔发现，在印度中尉多得不得了，没人要。

sentences.english: Churchill began with short stories and moved to playwriting in college.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔开始短篇小说和剧本中转移到学院。

sentences.english: Cameron strikes a Churchillian tone when he talks about the nation’s austerity plans.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅伦在谈到国家的紧缩计划时用的是丘吉尔的论调。

sentences.english: You're already at Churchill Downs to watch the horse race.
sentences.chinese: 你已经在丘吉尔唐斯赛马场观看赛马了。

sentences.english: Winston Churchill was born in a ladies' room during a dance.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔出生在一个舞会的女厕所里。

sentences.english: All agreed that the Churchills did not have the right to do what they had done.
sentences.chinese: 大家都同意出丘吉尔夫妇没有权利那样做。

sentences.english: The Churchill bushfire burnt out more than 30, 000 hectares of land.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔山火烧毁了超过3万公顷的土地。

sentences.english: Churchill's is the most recognized one of the great orators and statesmen.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔是公认的最伟大的政治家和演说家之一。

sentences.english: The socialists were trying to smear churchill as a warmonger .
sentences.chinese: 工党企图诽谤丘吉尔先生是战争贩子。

sentences.english: Michael Baze arrived at Churchill Downs with the right surname.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔巴泽抵达丘吉尔唐斯姓的权利。

sentences.english: All agreed that the Churchills didn't have the right to do what they had done.
sentences.chinese: 人们一致认为丘吉尔夫妇无权做他们已经做过的事情。

sentences.english: Churchill would even sleep here on occasions.
sentences.chinese: 有时候丘吉尔甚至睡在这里。

sentences.english: Winston Churchill was born in a ladies' room during dance.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔出生在一个舞会的女厕所里。

sentences.english: The portrait of Churchill brought Karsh international fame.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔的肖像的国际声誉带来了卡什。

sentences.english: Mr. Winant, the American Ambassador in London, saw Mr. Churchill last night.
sentences.chinese: 美国驻伦敦大使怀南特先生昨夜会见了丘吉尔。

definition: Winston Churchill (1874-1965), UK politican and prime minister 1940-1945 and 1951-1955/surname Churchill
Adolf Hitler (1889-1945)
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator
Benito Mussolini (1883-1945), Italian fascist dictator, "Il Duce", president 1922-1943
Napoleon (name)/Napoleon Bonaparte (1769-1821), Emperor of France 1804-1815
variant of 拿破崙|拿破仑[Na2 po4 lun2]
Thatcher (name)/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Bismarck (name)/Otto von Bismarck (1815-1898), Prussian politician, Minister-President of Prussia 1862-1873, Chancellor of Germany 1871-1890
Joseph Goebbels (1897-1945), German Nazi leader and politician
prime minister (of Japan or UK etc)
Dunkirk, port in northern France
Henry V (1387-1422), English warrior king, victor of Agincourt/History of Henry V by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚[Sha1 shi4 bi3 ya4]
Nazi Germany (1933-1945)
Nazi (loanword)
